instruction: Rinse seeraga samba rice 2–3 times until the water runs clear. Soak it in water for 30 minutes.

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:24.180 I had shown Nambur biryani earlier, but today I'm making Ambur biryani. It's very simple and quick to prepare.

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:36.180 --> 00:00:42.180 Add mint leaves, coriander leaves, pudina, half a spoon of black pepper, garam masala, and one tablespoon of red chili powder and turmeric.

instruction: Add cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, and fennel seeds. Sauté until fragrant.

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:36.180 --> 00:00:42.180 Add mint leaves, coriander leaves, pudina, half a spoon of black pepper, garam masala, and one tablespoon of red chili powder and turmeric.

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:36.180 --> 00:00:42.180 Add mint leaves, coriander leaves, pudina, half a spoon of black pepper, garam masala, and one tablespoon of red chili powder and turmeric.

instruction: Stir in ginger paste and garlic paste. Cook for 1–2 minutes until the raw smell disappears.

00:01:16.960 --> 00:01:22.080 Don’t use a big vessel. Use a flat-bottomed pot for best results.
00:01:22.080 --> 00:01:29.080 If you have biryani pots at home, use a medium-sized one. For 1 kg, this size works well.
00:01:29.080 --> 00:01:32.080 If not, use a pressure cooker, but don’t close it fully.
00:01:32.080 --> 00:01:40.080 You can also use a thick-bottomed vessel for better heat retention.

instruction: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and the oil starts to separate.

transcript_segments.text: 00:01:46.080 --> 00:01:50.280 Now it’s cooking—let’s prepare the tomato mixture.
00:02:00.800 --> 00:02:06.760 Now it’s ready. I’ve sautéed the tomatoes in oil.
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:17.640 Add a bit more tomato for this biryani than usual.
00:02:17.640 --> 00:02:20.160 Add a few more than usual, around four.
00:02:20.160 --> 00:02:24.840 I’ve taken three finely chopped tomatoes.
00:02:24.840 --> 00:02:27.000 If you don’t have puree, chop and use them.
00:02:29.080 --> 00:02:35.760 Unlike dum biryani, Ambur biryani is more like a pulav with dum at the end.

instruction: Mix in the ground red chilli paste and turmeric powder. Sauté for 3–4 minutes.

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:35.760 --> 00:02:39.900 Add red chili powder, coriander powder, and mix well.

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:35.760 --> 00:02:39.900 Add red chili powder, coriander powder, and mix well.
00:02:39.900 --> 00:02:46.220 Mix well and cook until the oil separates. The taste comes from this base.
00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Add cleaned mutton or chicken. Season with salt. Stir well to coat the meat with the masala.

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Cover and cook the meat on medium heat until it is tender and oil begins to separate from the masala. Stir occasionally.

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: In a separate large pot, bring enough water to a boil. Add a pinch of salt.

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Add the soaked rice to boiling water and cook until it's about 80% cooked. The grains should be firm but cooked through.
title: Cook Rice Until 80% Done

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Drain the rice immediately using a colander and set aside.

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Spread the semi-cooked rice evenly over the cooked meat masala in the pot.
title: Layer Rice Over Meat

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Drizzle lemon juice over the rice. Sprinkle some mint and coriander leaves for extra aroma.
title: Add Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Cover the pot tightly with a lid (use dough or foil for a better seal). Cook on a low flame for 15–20 minutes (dum cooking).

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes before opening the lid.
title: Rest the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:46.220 --> 00:02:52.200 Then add garam masala, cooked rice, coriander, and pudina. Fry this nicely.

instruction: Gently fluff and mix the biryani from the sides without breaking the rice. Serve hot with brinjal curry and raita.
